t: John 5
After*p this there was a feast of the Jews; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
Now*p there is at Jerusalem by the sheep market a pool, which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda, having five porches.
In*p these lay a great multitude of impotent folk, of blind, halt, withered, waiting for the moving of the water.
For*p an angel went down at a certain season into the pool, and troubled the water: whosoever then first after the troubling of the water stepped in was made whole of whatsoever disease he had.
And*p a certain man was there, which had an infirmity thirty and eight years.
When*p Jesus saw him lie, and knew that he had been now a long time in that case, he saith unto him, Wilt*r thou*r be*r made*r whole?*r
The*p impotent man answered him, Sir, I have no man, when the water is troubled, to put me into the pool: but while I am coming, another steppeth down before me.
Jesus*p saith unto him, Rise,*r take*r up*r thy*r bed,*r and*r walk.*r
And*p immediately the man was made whole, and took up his bed, and walked: and on the same day was the sabbath.
The*p Jews therefore said unto him that was cured, It is the sabbath day: it is not lawful for thee to carry thy bed.
He*p answered them, He that made me whole, the same said unto me, Take*r up*r thy*r bed,*r and*r walk.*r
Then*p asked they him, What man is that which said unto thee, Take*r up*r thy*r bed,*r and*r walk?*r
And*p he that was healed wist not who it was: for Jesus had conveyed himself away, a multitude being in that place.
Afterward*p Jesus findeth him in the temple, and said unto him, Behold,*r thou*r art*r made*r whole:*r sin*r no*r more,*r lest*r a*r worse*r thing*r come*r unto*r thee.*r
The*p man departed, and told the Jews that it was Jesus, which had made him whole.
And*p therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus, and sought to slay him, because he had done these things on the sabbath day.
But*p Jesus answered them, My*r Father*r worketh*r hitherto,*r and*r I*r work.*r
Therefore*p the Jews sought the more to kill him, because he not only had broken the sabbath, but said also that God was his Father, making himself equal with God.

Then*p answered Jesus and said unto them, Verily,*r verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r The*r Son*r can*r do*r nothing*r of*r himself,*r but*r what*r he*r seeth*r the*r Father*r do:*r for*r what*r things*r soever*r he*r doeth,*r these*r also*r doeth*r the*r Son*r likewise.*r
For*rp the*r Father*r loveth*r the*r Son,*r and*r sheweth*r him*r all*r things*r that*r himself*r doeth:*r and*r he*r will*r shew*r him*r greater*r works*r than*r these,*r that*r ye*r may*r marvel.*r
For*rp as*r the*r Father*r raiseth*r up*r the*r dead,*r and*r quickeneth*r them;*r even*r so*r the*r Son*r quickeneth*r whom*r he*r will.*r
For*rp the*r Father*r judgeth*r no*r man,*r but*r hath*r committed*r all*r judgment*r unto*r the*r Son:*r
That*rp all*r men*r should*r honour*r the*r Son,*r even*r as*r they*r honour*r the*r Father.*r He*r that*r honoureth*r not*r the*r Son*r honoureth*r not*r the*r Father*r which*r hath*r sent*r him.*r

Verily,*rp verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r He*r that*r heareth*r my*r word,*r and*r believeth*r on*r him*r that*r sent*r me,*r hath*r everlasting*r life,*r and*r shall*r not*r come*r into*r condemnation;*r but*r is*r passed*r from*r death*r unto*r life.*r

Verily,*rp verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r The*r hour*r is*r coming,*r and*r now*r is,*r when*r the*r dead*r shall*r hear*r the*r voice*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r God:*r and*r they*r that*r hear*r shall*r live.*r
For*rp as*r the*r Father*r hath*r life*r in*r himself;*r so*r hath*r he*r given*r to*r the*r Son*r to*r have*r life*r in*r himself;*r
And*rp hath*r given*r him*r authority*r to*r execute*r judgment*r also,*r because*r he*r is*r the*r Son*r of*r man.*r
Marvel*rp not*r at*r this:*r for*r the*r hour*r is*r coming,*r in*r the*r which*r all*r that*r are*r in*r the*r graves*r shall*r hear*r his*r voice,*r
And*rp shall*r come*r forth;*r they*r that*r have*r done*r good,*r unto*r the*r resurrection*r of*r life;*r and*r they*r that*r have*r done*r evil,*r unto*r the*r resurrection*r of*r damnation.*r

I*rp can*r of*r mine*r own*r self*r do*r nothing:*r as*r I*r hear,*r I*r judge:*r and*r my*r judgment*r is*r just;*r because*r I*r seek*r not*r mine*r own*r will,*r but*r the*r will*r of*r the*r Father*r which*r hath*r sent*r me.*r
If*rp I*r bear*r witness*r of*r myself,*r my*r witness*r is*r not*r true.*r
There*rp is*r another*r that*r beareth*r witness*r of*r me;*r and*r I*r know*r that*r the*r witness*r which*r he*r witnesseth*r of*r me*r is*r true.*r
Ye*rp sent*r unto*r John,*r and*r he*r bare*r witness*r unto*r the*r truth.*r
But*rp I*r receive*r not*r testimony*r from*r man:*r but*r these*r things*r I*r say,*r that*r ye*r might*r be*r saved.*r
He*rp was*r a*r burning*r and*r a*r shining*r light:*r and*r ye*r were*r willing*r for*r a*r season*r to*r rejoice*r in*r his*r light.*r

But*rp I*r have*r greater*r witness*r than*r that*r of*r John:*r for*r the*r works*r which*r the*r Father*r hath*r given*r me*r to*r finish,*r the*r same*r works*r that*r I*r do,*r bear*r witness*r of*r me,*r that*r the*r Father*r hath*r sent*r me.*r
And*rp the*r Father*r himself,*r which*r hath*r sent*r me,*r hath*r borne*r witness*r of*r me.*r Ye*r have*r neither*r heard*r his*r voice*r at*r any*r time,*r nor*r seen*r his*r shape.*r
And*rp ye*r have*r not*r his*r word*r abiding*r in*r you:*r for*r whom*r he*r hath*r sent,*r him*r ye*r believe*r not.*r
Search*rp the*r scriptures;*r for*r in*r them*r ye*r think*r ye*r have*r eternal*r life:*r and*r they*r are*r they*r which*r testify*r of*r me.*r
And*rp ye*r will*r not*r come*r to*r me,*r that*r ye*r might*r have*r life.*r
I*rp receive*r not*r honour*r from*r men.*r
But*rp I*r know*r you,*r that*r ye*r have*r not*r the*r love*r of*r God*r in*r you.*r
I*rp am*r come*r in*r my*r Father's*r name,*r and*r ye*r receive*r me*r not:*r if*r another*r shall*r come*r in*r his*r own*r name,*r him*r ye*r will*r receive.*r
How*rp can*r ye*r believe,*r which*r receive*r honour*r one*r of*r another,*r and*r seek*r not*r the*r honour*r that*r cometh*r from*r God*r only?*r
Do*rp not*r think*r that*r I*r will*r accuse*r you*r to*r the*r Father:*r there*r is*r one*r that*r accuseth*r you,*r even*r Moses,*r in*r whom*r ye*r trust.*r
For*rp had*r ye*r believed*r Moses,*r ye*r would*r have*r believed*r me:*r for*r he*r wrote*r of*r me.*r
But*rp if*r ye*r believe*r not*r his*r writings,*r how*r shall*r ye*r believe*r my*r words?*r
